column4: if you just set the partition to not be formated, the /home will not be deleted
if your data is really important, you should have backups anyway
and let me repeat, if you care about your data you should backup, there is a lot others things that can make you lose your data, besides formatting
if you run all your apps with a regular user, the data is alls kept on their respective home dir
it copies files from the current dir to /new
because cp * does not handle symbolic links
no, I already told you a long time a go how to proceed, select your / partition to install, but just make sure the format option is disabled, /home will not be deleted
with that one very complicated command for copying into the new dir are all the links to your browserprefs and mailclientinboxes preserved?
if you don't have a clear understand of the commands you are executing, you are endangering your copy
if you already have an installation, why not just upgrade with the update-manager ?
I did that now I can't get into it anymore
many have adviced me to do a clean install
what is your problem logging in ?
you mean, it does not start the graphical login manager ?
